So this ad is for information only.
So i had got tired of going to Wal-mart and there was no 22lr ammo.
So i bought.
1. Bone Collector np .177 1300 fps Air Rifle.
2. Benjamin Titan np 22 cal.  
3. Benjamin trail np .177 pistol.
and i have shot metal targets on my property and this is my thoughts about Air Rifles vs 22lr.
Air Rifles are not as expensive to buy vs 22lr's, shoot really cheap ammo 750 rounds of .177 is $8 and 500 rounds of 22 cal is $8 but even though they are single shots they pack power and you can practice shooting just as you do with a regular 22lr, the only difference is the range is shorter so there are no 100 yard shots for me they are more like 50 yard shots, but i can shoot all day and spend pennies vs dealing with ammo scalpers wanting $80 for a brick of 22lr they just bought for $24 at Wal-Mart,.
You will need to lube and clean your Air Rifle just as you do a regular gun but USE AIR RIFLE CLEANING KITS AND LUBE.
I buy the break barrel air rifles as they pack some heat each shot, but beware if you get a 25 cal., air rifle the ammo is real hard to find so stick to 22 or 177, these new air rifles are light years beyond the old school pump air rifles we had when i was a kid, these are not toys they are competition air rifles with velocities up to 1650 feet per second and thats screaming power behind a pellet. Now Air Rifles of this power are not allowed to be shot in most city limits so check local laws, but felons can own them, shot them as long as they have completed their probation and most of the time as long as their release does not state they can not shoot them, they have the ability to do so, but check first. 
If anyone has questions about my Air Rifles just ask me.
i have added a photo of my abused targets to give you an idea of what they do to metal targets and paper at about 50 yards.
